item.title: Monitoring Resources with Grafana
item.description: Grafana Version: 6.0.2 Linux Version: RHEL 6 NGINX Version: 1.15.10 Grafana is “the leading open source software for time series analytics”. It should be taken under great consideration if you are looking to: monitor a wide range of resources and their statistics set up real-time alerts and notifications create dashboards which can be put in kiosk view for constant live monitoring This post will take you through the basic steps of installing Grafana, setting up data sources, creating dashboards, configuring notification channels and alerts, and configuring port forwarding for the application using NGINX.

item.title: Migrating MySQL Database and Users
item.description: Linux Versions: RHEL 6 Ubuntu 14 MySQL Version: 5.7 I recently migrated a MySQL database between servers, and with that, all of the existing users with their passwords and grants. Being that I had to span multiple resources to gather all of the information I needed, I figured it would be helpful if all of these resources could be in the same place so that future users can have a simpler time looking to accomplish the same thing.

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: This is the beginnings of my website’s migration back to Hugo to start up my blog again. Hugo is “the world’s fastest framework for building websites”, which is great because I often (mercilessly) rebuild pages over and over again, even after the tiniest of changes, to confirm that I like the way they look. If you don’t know yet, my name is Michael A. Agarenzo, and I am a Software Engineer.
